abstract: There's something very sexy-cool about a glossy, nude lip.
snippet: There's something very sexy-cool about a glossy, nude lip.
lead_paragraph: There's something very sexy-cool about a glossy, nude lip. It says, "I'm hot, but I didn't try too hard," and it works for almost everyone. (And for almost every designer, judging by how many copped the bare-lip look for their resort and spring shows.) It's also super-low-maintenance. "You don't have to be concerned that your color will bleed," says Lisa Houghton, who did the makeup on the previous page. The only caveat: you need a well-prepped pucker. Houghton exfoliated our model's lips by dabbing on a bit of Elizabeth Arden Eight Hour Cream and rubbing it off with a tissue. Then she applied a mixture of Arden's Crystal Clear Lip Gloss and a touch of High Shine Lip Gloss in Tropicoral for the right pinkish tone.
